It seems they do not apply weight decay for Adam and Momentum.
I just checked the Apply Gradient part, and I think they won't apply weight decay when calculate gradient.
So I think nothing to FIX.
If you want something like AdamW (Adam + weight decay), you can add L2 regularization yourself.
I also checked the implementation of mxnet. They do support weight decay, and with the wrong way (based on that paper).
https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/d511d98aeadf4392f8c4c1289d15feecdd98bf81/src/operator/optimizer_op-inl.h#L718
Correct me if I'm wrong.
